title: Karl Scully
text:
Karl Scully (born 10 June 1978) is an Irish <a href="opera">opera</a> <a href="tenor">tenor</a>.
Early life.
Karl Scully was born in <a href="Limerick">Limerick</a>, <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a>. He is a graduate of the <a href="Manhattan%20School%20of%20Music">Manhattan School of Music</a> and was a recipient of the Liberace Scholarship and the Mae Zenke Orvis Endowed Opera Scholarship.
Career.
He kick-started his career in 2000 when he played the role of Count John McCormack in the cinematic film “Nora”, by Pat Murphy and Gerard Stembridge, starring <a href="Ewan%20McGregor">Ewan McGregor</a>. He followed his on screen success by performing operatic roles such as: Don Jose in “Carmen” by Bizet; The Witch in “Hansel and Gretel” by Humperdinck; MacHeath, in “Beggars Opera” and Albert, in “Albert Herring” by Benjamin Britten; King Ouf in “L'etoile” by Chabrier; Paolino, in "Il Matrimonio Segreto" by Cimarosa; Ferrando, in “Cosi Fan Tutte” by Mozart; and Arturo in “Lucia di Lammermoor" by Gaetano Donizetti. During his time in Italy, Karl was a permanent artist in the <a href="Teatro%20Carlo%20Felice">Teatro Carlo Felice</a> Opera House in Genoa. While there he performed solo roles alongside world-famous artists including <a href="Samuel%20Ramey">Samuel Ramey</a>, <a href="Robert%20Brubaker">Robert Brubaker</a>, and <a href="Dwayne%20Croft">Dwayne Croft</a>.
The Irish Tenors.
Karl's was heard by two Irish Tenors, <a href="Anthony%20Kearns">Anthony Kearns</a> and <a href="Finbar%20Wright">Finbar Wright</a>, who invited him to join the group in 2006. Soon after Karl returned to the screens to star in ‘The Irish Tenors and Friends,’ a 10 part television show.
From 2006–2011, Karl was a member of <a href="The%20Irish%20Tenors">The Irish Tenors</a> and performed with them and as a <a href="solo%20%28music%29">solo</a>ist in Europe and the USA.
